ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.controller

Class DomainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.controller.DomainController

  • public class DomainController
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an interface to execute the main subtasks required for the robot to perform the overall routine.

    The DomainController represents the low layer of the controller in the system. The class is not concerned with the general state of the main routine execution. Instead, the DomainController handles all the details related to each of the subtasks required for the main routine. This means that internally, the DomainCotroller handles all the required calls to more specialized classes and ensures that the requested subtask is completed.

    It is assumed that the caller of the DomainController methods (usually the MetaController) will conform to the external requirements of each subtask. For instance, a call to crossTunnel(3, 3, 4, 6) will not produce the expected outcome if the odometer of the robot has not been set to the right initial values through the localize() method.

    See Also:
    MetaController

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DomainController()
      Creates a DomainController and initializes all the required specialized classes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void approachTree()
      Approaches the tree containing the ring set and positions the robot looking into the nearest face.
      void crossTunnel()
      Crosses the tunnel specified by the given coordinates.
      void goToNextFace()
      Moves the robot to the next tree face in the counter-clockwise direction.
      void grabRings()
      Approaches the tree slowly, detects the color of a ring if any and attempts to get it.
      void localize()
      Uses the Localizer class to provide the odometer with an initial set of coordinates that correspond to the location of the robot with respect to the grid.
      void setMap(CoordinateMap map)
      Sets the map coordinates to be used during each of the tasks.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DomainController

        public DomainController()
                 throws OdometerException,
                        PollerException
        Creates a DomainController and initializes all the required specialized classes.

        Instantiation of the DomainController involves initializing the singleton Odometer, LightPoller, and UltrasonicPoller classes, which is required for the instantiation of other classes.

        Throws:
        OdometerException - If there is a problem while creating the Odometer singleton instance.
        PollerException - If the UltrasonicPoller or LightPoller have not been instantiated.
        See Also:
        Odometer, LightPoller, UltrasonicPoller

    • Method Detail

      • setMap

        public void setMap(CoordinateMap map)
        Sets the map coordinates to be used during each of the tasks.
        Parameters:
        map - Map to be used during the tasks.

      • localize

        public void localize()
        Uses the Localizer class to provide the odometer with an initial set of coordinates that correspond to the location of the robot with respect to the grid.
        See Also:
        Localizer

      • crossTunnel

        public void crossTunnel()
        Crosses the tunnel specified by the given coordinates. The method makes sure that the robot reaches the closest entrance of the tunnel, then it moves through it until the robot is completely outside on the other side.

      • approachTree

        public void approachTree()
        Approaches the tree containing the ring set and positions the robot looking into the nearest face.

      • goToNextFace

        public void goToNextFace()
        Moves the robot to the next tree face in the counter-clockwise direction. This method assumes the the robot is already looking into one of the three faces. This can be achieved by calling approachTree().

      • grabRings

        public void grabRings()
        Approaches the tree slowly, detects the color of a ring if any and attempts to get it. This method assumes that the robot is already looking into a face of the tree and positioned on the intersection right in front of it. If a color is detected a sequence of beeps matching the color encoding of the ColorDetector is issued. After the routine is over the robot goes back to the initial intersection where is was located before the method call.
        See Also:
        ColorDetector, ArmController
